summary: The diff adds a basic catalog/cart/checkout UI and a Motoko backend, but several core acceptance criteria are not met: backend product/order models donâ€™t match the spec (no inStock, no line-item orders, no timestamp), checkout submits only the first cart item, error handling/confirmation are implemented via sessionStorage rather than backend order details, and backend persistence/seed data for products/orders is missing. Some unrequested features were also added (Internet Identity plumbing, admin-like addProduct, category/search backend endpoints, shipping address requirement).

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend query method returns full product list including id, name, optional description, price, optional unit/size, category, and inStock/available.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend Product type lacks unit/size and inStock/available boolean (uses stock: Nat instead), and description is not optional.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend exposes an update method to create an order containing line items (productId, name snapshot, unit price snapshot, quantity), total amount, customer details (min: customer name), and created timestamp, returning a unique orderId.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend order model is a single-product order (productId/quantity), lacks line items array, lacks created timestamp, and lacks name/unit price snapshots; frontend also submits only the first cart item and stores confirmation details in sessionStorage rather than using backend-returned order details/timestamp.

missing_requirements.requirement: Frontend shows a user-friendly error message on submission failure and preserves cart + entered checkout fields.
missing_requirements.reason: Checkout catch block only logs to console; no visible Alert/error state is shown in the provided code snippet.

missing_requirements.requirement: Seeded products available on first load (no admin UI) and orders stored in stable state to persist across upgrades; backend methods documented with brief comments.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend uses in-memory Map and var counters without any stable storage, upgrade hooks, or seeded product initialization; code shown contains no brief method documentation comments.

missing_requirements.requirement: Generated logo and background images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced from the frontend.
missing_requirements.reason: Frontend references the assets by path, but the diff summary does not show the actual image files being added under frontend/public/assets/generated (some files were omitted due to limits), so presence cannot be confirmed from available evidence.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication/provider and actor recreation logic added (useInternetIdentity, InternetIdentityProvider, identity-aware actor creation).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly says third-party auth providers are out of scope and Internet Identity should be added only if explicitly requested later; it was not requested here.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend admin-like product creation endpoint addProduct (and getProduct).
hallucinated_features.reason: Spec did not request product creation endpoints; products were to be seeded (no admin management).

hallucinated_features.description: Backend category and name-search endpoints (getProductsByCategory, searchProductsByName).
hallucinated_features.reason: Spec only required a single query to return the full product list; filtering/search could be client-side.

hallucinated_features.description: Checkout requires/collects shipping address and backend stores shippingAddress on the order.
hallucinated_features.reason: Spec requires at minimum customer name; phone/email/note are optional. Shipping address was not requested.
